oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic operators’ satisfaction with their certification body – a survey in Germany
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zorn, Alexander
Renner, Heike
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Values, standards and certification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic certification represents different functions for the stakeholders involved in this process. For a producer of organic food, it is mainly a service provided by a certification body. Hardly any information currently exists on organic operators’ satisfaction with this service. In a survey of German organic processors, we examine the satisfaction and other questions connected to the relationship certification body – client and offer insights for certification bodies and organic associations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Zorn, Alexander and Renner, Heike (2008) Organic operators’ satisfaction with their certification body – a survey in Germany. Poster at: Cultivating the Future Based on Science: 2nd Conference of the International Society of Organic Agriculture Research ISOFAR, Modena, Italy, June 18-20, 2008.
